instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> row of key not working even with new keyboard
threads.message:
Cant find any liquid.
Tested with three keyboards and on external systems.
Keys 3, e, d, c are not working

All pins on J4813 got connection with test points on board.
J4813 Looks ok, no corrosion etc.

Tested with 100% working trackpad and trackpad cable as well.

Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> row of key not working even with new keyboard
threads.message:
Check continuity between <CHIP>U4801</CHIP> and carbon traces of keyboard flex.
You can access the traces near J4813.
In this way you can discard a bad contact inside J4813.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> row of key not working even with new keyboard
threads.message:
One of the pads on <CHIP>U4801</CHIP> at <SIGNAL>WS_KBD</SIGNAL>... was not connected with board.
Solved - many thanks :)
